title: Forest Farm Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Mick Lobb / Snowdrops at Forest Farm
images.caption: Snowdrops at Forest Farm

images.title: Mick Lobb / The River Taff adjacent to Forest Farm
images.caption: The River Taff adjacent to Forest Farm. The Taff Trail runs beside the river and the Forest Farm Country Park between Whitchurch and Radyr at this point.

images.caption: Lock on the Glamorganshire Canal - on the eastern side of the park.

images.title: nantcoly / Radyr Weir and Taff valley railway line
images.caption: Radyr Weir and Taff valley railway line. Photo taken from the east bank of the Taff July 2005 Radyr weir is the latest of many such structures on the site the first of which was built in the 12th Century

images.title: The Taff Trail near Radyr by Robin Drayton, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Taff Trail near Radyr

description: This lovely country park and nature reserve in Cardiff is a great place for a peaceful cycle or walk. There are 150 acres to explore with a section of the Taff Trail running through the park alongside the River Taff. The Glamorganshire Canal or Cardiff Merthyr canal runs through the site - look out for Kingfishers and Herons on the water in this area. There is also a peaceful woodland section.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The trails in the park are good for dog walking and you probably see families with their pets on your outing.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Also in Cardiff you'll find the popular Bute Park. The large park includes beautiful gardens, tree lined avenues, an arboretum and the historic Cardiff Castle.

display_address: Ty Mawr Road, Coryton, Llandaff North, Cardiff, Cymru / Wales, CF14 2HG, United Kingdom
